Package org.tealeaf.javamarkdown.types

Class ListStructure

java.lang.Object
org.tealeaf.javamarkdown.MarkdownElement
org.tealeaf.javamarkdown.types.Structure
org.tealeaf.javamarkdown.types.ListStructure
Direct Known Subclasses:
BulletList, NamedListStructure, NumberedList
public abstract class ListStructure extends Structure
Represents a structure that lists elements in a list-like structure
Since:
0.0.7

    • requiresNewlineBefore

      public boolean requiresNewlineBefore()

      Whether the element requires at least one \n before printing itself in a document

      In instances such as in-line elements (like markup.Bold), this would return false because bolds can be inserted directly in-line. However, in instances such as lists.NumberedList, it would be required that there is a new line to prevent the following 

           Some sentence - item 1
     - item 2
     - item 3

      and instead print the following

           Some sentence
     - item 1
     - item 2

      This method is natively used in MarkdownWriter.appendMarkdownElement(MarkdownElement) to handle adding newlines when necessary

      Specified by:
      requiresNewlineBefore in class MarkdownElement
      Returns:
      true
      Since:
      0.0.7
      See Also:
      • MarkdownWriter.appendMarkdownElement(MarkdownElement)

    • requiresNewlineAfter

      public boolean requiresNewlineAfter()

      Whether a new line should be added after inserting the element into a document. This is particularly useful for structures that need to have a newline after it gets rendered

      For example, if some text was printed immediately after a list, it would render as:

           - item 1
     - item 2
     - item 3some text

      Thus, by requiring a new line after the element is rendered, we get the following output instead:

           - item 1
     - item 2
     - item 3
     some text

      This method is natively used in MarkdownWriter.appendMarkdownElement(MarkdownElement) to handle adding newlines when necessary

      Specified by:
      requiresNewlineAfter in class MarkdownElement
      Returns:
      true
      Since:
      0.0.7
      See Also:
      • MarkdownWriter()

    • indentItem

      @Deprecated protected String indentItem(String item)
      Deprecated.
      Implemented in printItem(int)

      Idents an item to properly fit in the list

      Takes each \n and adds spaces after it to indent it to the indentation required by the symbol

      Parameters:
      item - String to format
      Returns:
      String formatted to the indentation of the item
      Since:
      0.0.7
